description: From (deprecated) genus name Zooxanthella, from Ancient Greek ζῷον (zôion, “animal”) + ξανθός (xanthós, “yellow”) + -ella.

entries.meaning: (archaic) Any of the yellow pigmentary particles, or minute corpuscles of yellow coloring matter, found in certain radiolarians.
Any of various typically yellow-brown dinoflagellates (originally grouped as genus Zooxanthella) now assigned to the genera Symbiodinium and Amphidinium, notably found in coral reefs.
